The unbelieving Jews of Thessalonica, filled with jealousy and hatred of the apostles, and not content with having driven them from their own city, followed them to Berea and aroused against them the excitable passions of the lower class. Fearing that violence would be done to Paul if he 
                                                                           233
remained there, the brethren sent him to Athens, accompanied by some of the Bereans who had newly accepted the faith.
